intro: Ichnanthus venturii, commonly known as the Florida sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as pine flatwoods and scrublands. It has small, narrow leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Ichnanthus venturii is considered a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution and specific habitat requirements.
